ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the day when it reveals
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the day when it shines in all its glory,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and by the day when it breaks in its glory,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: by the day when it appears radiant,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the day when it shines
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: By the day as it appears.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the day when it shines in brightness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and by the day as it appears radiantly,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the day when it appeareth in glory,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by the day when it brightens,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By the Day as it appears in glory;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by the day as it appears in brightness;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and by the day when it unveils.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the day as it reveals.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the day when it appears
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [92:2] and [by] the day as it unveils, [as] it is revealed and becomes manifest (idhā, ‘as’, in both instances is an absolute adverbial, operated by the verbal action of the oath),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the day resplendent) and the day when it clears the darkness of night.
